𓊘 granary, pile of grain 𓍲 𓏌 𓏏 𓊘 Schnitt?

𓊘 𓉐 hombár 𓅓 𓂝 𓌨 𓂋 𓉐 ամբար ambar хамба́р hambár hambar chamber

O51 𓊘 [granary] ⋍ court[ier] 𓊘

𓍲 𓏌 𓏏 𓊘 | granary | šurt < court ⇔ 𐂜 Quart √ kur 𓍲 𓏌 𓏏 𓊘 | granary | σιτα ⇔ Schnitter / σιταποθήκη շտեմարան štemaran 𒅎 𓍲 𓏌 𓏏 𓊘 | granary | شُونَة šūna™ ^^

𓐍 𓏏 𓅓 𓇋 𓇋 𓏏 𓋩 𓉐 | sealed chamber | 󴔫 𓏏 𓉐 𓏥 | altar-chamber | 𓐍 𓈖 𓏏 𓂉 | council-chamber | 𓏅 𓈖 𓏏 𓏮 𓂉 𓉐 | outer-chamber | 𓍕 𓏏 𓉐 | outer-chamber | 𓈙 𓏏 𓍘 𓇋 𓇋 𓏏 𓉗 | chamber | Stätte 𓇋 𓇩 𓋴 𓉐 | tomb, council chamber, 𓂝 𓏏 𓉐 | room, chamber, house |

𒈾𒀸𒉺𒆠𒅎 na-aš-pa-ki-im 𓍲 𓏌 𓏏 𓊘 / 𓊘 𓏏 𓉐 nathpor™graimen ? 𒈾𒀸𒉺𒆠𒅎 na-aš-pa-ki-im <> अन्नागार annāgār 𒈾𒀸𒉺𒆠𒅎 granary

While storage belongs to archaic-inventions Communal granaries are a specific invention at the onset of the neolithic * 9500 BC stiltet granary 𓊘 Jordan Dhra' & Karahan Tepe (AB) On raised poles for ventilation, dehydration and pest control Upper part built with sealed mud for cooling, dehydration and pest control Only accessible through adjecent special building in Karahan Tepe (ancient architects)?
